decision_conditions: <p>The proposed extensions would breach the horizontal 45 degree line of the adjoining property leading to considerable loss of light and outlook to habitable windows close to the boundary of no. 9 Coledale Drive, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), Policy D3.D1 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>

<p>The proposed two-storey side and rear extensions, by reason of their excessive depth beyond the rear elevation, massing, poor and inconsistent design and piecemeal appearance, would result in an overly dominant, and visually obtrusive form of development, at odds with the prevailing visual character of both the host property and wider area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), Policy D3.D1 and D11 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>
description: First floor side to rear extension
